attributes.comment:
On behalf of all adopted families, I am very displeased with the proposed USCIS
fee increases. As a new parent of an adopted child, my wife and I have paid
considerable amounts of money so that we can fulfill our dreams of starting a
family. There are many hardships, most importantly financial, for those that adopt
and I believe increasing fees will only hinder and discourage those whose only
chance to start a family is through adoption.

In my profession, I fight unjustified fee increases and unfunded federal mandates
on a daily basis. The fees that are proposed are unjustified. They are
approximately a 14% and 23% increase. There are no new, improved, or fast-
tracked services being offered to justify the increase - only an increase for
revenue. I will guarantee the majority of those adopting will have to resubmit a
new I-171H due to its time limitations that will again increase our costs.

The proposed changes include:
1.) Biometrics (fingerprints) from $70 to $80 per person, and
2.) the I-600A from $545 to $670.

In conclusion, the fees are unjustified and with each increase, no matter how
small it may seem, will price out caring individuals and couples from being able to
adopt.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Michael J. Mennett
